sen.j: 京の花街（きょうのかがい/はなまち）では、京都にある花街について述べる。
sen.e: In this section of the Kyo no Hanamachi, the hanamachi ('flower town,' or geisha district) in Kyoto will be explained.
In this section of the Kyo no Hanamachi, the hanamachi ('flower town,' or geisha district) in Kyoto will be explained.
In this section of the Kyo no Hanamachi, the hanamachi (Kagai) ('flower town,' or geisha district) in Kyoto will be explained.

sen.j: 京都には6つの花街があり、それぞれの個性によって構成されている。
sen.e: There are six hanamachi in Kyoto, and each has its own characteristics
There are six hanamachi in Kyoto, and each has its own characteristics

sen.j: しかし、花街としての機能を果たしているのは嶋原を除く5ヶ所でそれらをまとめて『五花街』（ごかがい）と呼ばれている。
sen.e: However, only five of them except Shimabara currently functions as a geisha district, and accordingly, they are collectively referred to as "Go-kagai" (five hanamachi, or kagai).
However, only five of them except Shimabara currently function as a geisha district, and accordingly, they are collectively referred to as "Go-kagai" (five hanamachi, or kagai).

tit.e: Rok-kagai (six hanamachi, or kagai: 六花街)

sen.j: 京都最古の花街で京都市上京区真盛町から社家長屋町に位置する。
sen.e: Kamishichiken is the oldest hanamachi, located in the area of Shinsei Town and Shakenagaya Town in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Kamishichiken is the oldest hanamachi, located in the area of Shinsei Town and Shakenagaya Town in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Kamishichiken is the oldest hanamachi, located in the area of Shinsei-cho and Shakenagaya-cho in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 室町時代に北野天満宮の再建の際に残った機材を使って7軒の茶店を建てた。
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, seven tea houses were built with leftover materials from the reconstruction of the Kitano Tenmangu Shrine.
In the Muromachi period, seven tea houses were built with leftover materials from the reconstruction of the Kitano Tenmangu Shrine.
In the Muromachi period, seven tea houses were built with leftover materials from the reconstruction of the Kitano Tenmangu Shrine.

sen.j: これが「上七軒」の由来で、桃山時代に豊臣秀吉が北野で大茶会を開いた折に茶店側は団子を献上したところ大いに誉められて以来、また西陣の結びつきで花街としての繁栄を極める。
sen.e: The name 'Kamishichiken' (literally meaning 'upper seven houses') originated from this fact, and Kamishichiken has prospered as a hanamachi, with close ties to Nishijin, ever since Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI held a large tea ceremony in Kitano in the Momoyama period and greatly praised the dumpling cake the tea house served.

sen.j: 毎年春になると『北野をどり』が上演されて少数ながらにして良い技芸を磨き披露している。
sen.e: The "Kitano Odori" (dance originally performed at the Kitano Tenmangu Shrine) is performed annually in April; geisha and apprentice geisha practice traditional performing arts every day and show them beautifully although small in number.

The "Kitano Odori" (dance originally performed at the Kitano Tenmangu Shrine) is performed annually in spring; geisha and apprentice geisha practice traditional performing arts every day and show them beautifully although small in number.

sen.j: 京都で最大の花街で日本国内のみならず海外でも知られている。
sen.e: Gion Kobu is the largest hanamachi in Kyoto and is known abroad as well as in Japan.
Gion Kobu is the largest hanamachi in Kyoto and is known abroad as well as in Japan.
Gion Kobu is the largest hanamachi in Kyoto and is known abroad as well as in Japan.

sen.j: 江戸時代初期に八坂神社の門前で水茶屋を営業したのが始まりで以後、花街として発展し正式に許可された。
sen.e: Gion Kobu started with the opening of a tea house in front of the gate of the Yasaka-jinja Shrine in the beginning of the Edo period; thereafter, Gion Kobu flourished as a hanamachi and received official approval.

Gion Kobu started with the opening of a tea house in front of the gate of the Yasaka-jinja Shrine in the beginning of the Edo period; thereafter, Gion Kobu flourished as a hanamachi and received official approval.

sen.j: このときに団子をモチーフにした紋章が作られ、現在も祇園甲部と祇園東の紋章として使われている。
sen.e: The emblem featuring dumpling cake was created then, and it is still used as the emblem for Gion Kobu and Gion Higashi.
The emblem featuring dumpling cake was created then, and it is still used as the emblem for Gion Kobu and Gion Higashi.

sen.j: 江戸末期にはお茶屋が500軒、芸妓、舞妓、娼妓合わせて1000人以上いたという。
sen.e: At the end of the Edo period, Gion Kobu was said to have boasted five hundred tea houses and more than one thousand of geisha, apprentice geisha and shogi (prostitutes) in total.
At the end of the Edo period, Gion Kobu was said to have boasted five hundred tea houses and more than one thousand of geisha, apprentice geisha and shogi (prostitutes) in total.

sen.j: 明治5年、東京奠都で寂れかけた京都を立て直そうと槇村正直が博覧会の余興として都をどりが上演された。
sen.e: To revitalize Kyoto, which was on the brink of decline due to the Tokyo-tento (designation of Tokyo as capital), Masanao MAKIMURA had Miyako Odori (Dance of the Capital) performed in the Kyoto Exhibition as an entertainment.

To revitalize Kyoto, which was on the brink of decline due to the Tokyo-tento (designation of Tokyo as capital), Masanao MAKIMURA had Miyako Odori (Dance of the Capital) performed in the Kyoto Exhibition as an entertainment.

sen.j: 振り付けの担当が三世井上八千代（本名 片山春子）が務めた。
sen.e: Yachiyo INOUE III (born Haruko KATAYAMA) choreographed the dance.
Yachiyo INOUE III (born Haruko KATAYAMA) choreographed the dance.

sen.j: 以後、祇園の舞は井上流一筋となる。
sen.e: The 'Gion no Mai' (Gion's dance) has been choreographed only by the Inoue School, thereafter.
The 'Gion no Mai' (Gion's dance) has been choreographed only by the Inoue School, thereafter.
The 'Gion no Mai' (Gion's dance) has been choreographed only by the Inoue School, thereafter.

sen.j: 祇園は多くの歌人や政治家等の著名人たちによって愛された。
sen.e: Gion has been loved by many prominent figures such as poets and politicians.
Gion has been loved by many prominent figures such as poets and politicians.

sen.j: 京都市東山区、四条花見小路上る東側に位置する花街。
sen.e: Gion Higashi is a hanamachi, located to the east of the Shijo-dori Street up north of the intersection of the Shijo-dori Street and the Hanami-koji Street.
Gion Higashi is a hanamachi, located to the east of the Shijo-dori Street up north of the intersection of the Shijo-dori Street and the Hanami-koji Street.

sen.j: 明治に入り祇園甲部から分離独立し、甲部に対し『祇園乙部』と称された。
sen.e: Separated from Gion Kobu in the Meiji period, Gion Higashi became an independent hanamachi and was called "Gion Otsubu" against Kobu ('ko' and 'otsu' in Japanese are equivalent to a and b in English).

sen.j: 乙部は主に娼妓数が多かった。
sen.e: Otsubu had more shogi (prostitutes) in general.

sen.j: 京都市下京区に位置する花街。
sen.e: Shimabara is a hanamachi located in Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Shimabara is a hanamachi located in Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Shimabara is a hanamachi located in Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 正式名称は西新屋敷で6つの町（上ノ町、中之町、中堂寺町、太夫町、下之町、揚屋町）で構成されている。
sen.e: The official name of the hanamachi is Nishi Shinyashiki, and it is comprised of the six towns of Kamino Town, Nakano Town, Chudouji Town, Tayu Town, Shimono Town and Ageya Town.
The official name of the hanamachi is Nishi Shinyashiki, and it is comprised of the six towns of Kamino Town, Nakano Town, Chudouji Town, Tayu Town, Shimono Town and Ageya Town.
The official name of the hanamachi is Nishi Shinyashiki, and it is comprised of the six towns of Kamino-cho, Nakano-cho, Chudouji-cho, Tayu-cho, Shimono-cho and Ageya-cho.

sen.j: 嶋原の歴史は古く、日本で最初の公許された花街であり室町時代に「九条の里」という傾城局が設置されたのが始まりだといわれる。
sen.e: Shimabara has a long history, and is believed to have been the first officially acknowledged hanamachi and have started with the opening of the 'Keisei no tsubone' (a courtesan house) called 'Kujo no Sato.'

Shimabara has a long history, and is believed to have been the first officially acknowledged hanamachi and have started with the opening of the 'Keisei no tsubone' (a courtesan house) called 'Kujo no Sato.'

sen.j: 桃山時代に二条万里小路に花街が豊臣秀吉によって移されたといい、江戸時代になると六条付近にうつされ、「六条三筋町」と称され吉野太夫等の名妓が輩出した。
sen.e: The hanamachi was said to have been transferred to Nijo-matenokoji by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in the Momoyama period and to the area near Rokujo in the Edo period; it was referred to as 'Rokujo-misuji Town,' having produced renowned geisha such as Yoshino-dayu (Geisha Yoshino with the honorary suffix 'dayu' for geisha added).

sen.j: 昭和時代後期に衰退し、現在は花街としては数えられなくなった。
sen.e: Shimabara declined in the late Showa period, and as a result, it is not regarded as a hanamachi any more.
Shimabara declined in the late Showa period, and as a result, it is not regarded as a hanamachi any more.

sen.j: 京都市中京区に位置し、鴨川と木屋町通の間にある花街。
sen.e: Ponto Town is a hanamachi, located between the Kamo-gawa River and the Kiyamachi-dori Street in Nakagyo Ward.
Ponto Town is a hanamachi, located between the Kamo-gawa River and the Kiyamachi-dori Street in Nakagyo Ward.
Ponto-cho is a hanamachi, located between Kamo-gawa River and Kiyamachi-dori Street in Nakagyo Ward.

sen.j: もともとは鴨川の州で、江戸時代初期に護岸工事で埋立てられ、新河原町通と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: The land was originally a sandbar on the Kamo-gawa River, but it was reclaimed through the bank protection work in the early Edo period and was called Shinkawaramachi-dori Street.
The land was originally a sandbar on the Kamo-gawa River, but was reclaimed through the bank protection work in the early Edo period and was called Shinkawaramachi-dori Street.
The land was originally a sandbar on the Kamo-gawa River, but was reclaimed through the bank protection work in the early Edo period and was called Shinkawaramachi-dori Street.

sen.j: 江戸初期、鴨川 (淀川水系)の周辺を開発しそこに茶屋、旅籠などが置かれたのが始まりですでに芸妓、娼妓が居住するようになり何度も取り締れていたが川端二条にあった『二条新地』（にじょうしんち）の出稼ぎ地として認められ、明治初期に独立をした。
sen.e: Ponto Town started with the development of the areas along the Kamo-gawa River, building tea houses and hatago (inn with meals); geisha and shogi had settled in and been cracked down repeatedly, but the area was recognized as a work place for those in "Nijo-shinchi" (Nijo new development area) in Kawabatanijo and was separated from Nijo-shinchi in the early Meiji period.

sen.j: 京都市東山区に位置しており、宮川筋二丁目から六丁目までが花街。
sen.e: Miyagawa Town is a hanamachi located in Higashiyama Ward and is comprised of the six sections from Ni-chome (section 2) to Roku-chome (section 6) in Miyagawasuji.

sen.j: 出雲阿国の歌舞伎踊りの時代から始まり、最初は若衆歌舞伎の小屋と茶屋が立ち並び10代の少年が接待をしていたので｢陰間｣と呼ばれていた花街だった。
sen.e: The hanamachi originated in the time of IZUMO no Okuni's Kabuki dance, and it was initially called 'Kagema' (male prostitute), for the area was lined with kabuki and tea houses for the 'wakashu' (a teenage kabuki apprentice and also male prostitute), and those boys entertained patrons.

sen.j: その後形態が変わり宝暦年間、正式に認可された。
sen.e: Subsequently, the hanamachi was reorganized and officially approved in the Horeki era.

sen.j: 明治、大正、昭和33年3月15日の売春防止法施行までは遊廓であり、今でも遊廓時代の建物が残っている。
sen.e: Brothels had existed through the Meiji and Taisho periods until March 15, 1958 in the Showa period when the Anti-Prostitution Law was enacted, and some buildings from the brothel days still remain today.
